"1. General
Meizu has always attached great importance to IPR protection and abided by Chinese IPR laws, regulations and binding regulatory documents.
All information on the Flyme OS, including but not limited to the entire content of all trademarks, identifiers, business name and logo, texts, images, audios, videos, and programs used on the Flyme OS. The Flyme OS layout, webpage design, Flyme OS architecture and data editing, software or program used and their intellectual property rights are all independently owned by Meizu or co-owned with legal right holders concerning the related content.
Unless otherwise provided by law, without written authorization from Meizu, no one shall be allowed to reproduce, edit, distribute, compile, modify, download, imitate, copy, republish, mirror, reverse engineer, or decompile or disassemble any content of copyright and other intellectual property rights owned by Meizu in any form, or else will be investigated for legal responsibility by Meizu according to laws and regulations.
The republication of web content on the Flyme OS by any third party within the limits of fair use must indicate the source, author and URL, and Meizu copyright symbol (if any) may not be removed; otherwise Meizu reserves the right to pursue its legal responsibilities.
Where texts or icons indicating a service from a third party, the final content of the service is determined and provided by the third party; Flyme OS only provides web services including automatic connection, automatic transmission, data storage space, search, linking or file-sharing technology. Meizu will not carry out any form of censorship, editing or modification on its content.
2. Notice of infringement and counter notification
According to the laws, regulations and requirements for normative documents of China, Meizu has developed measures and steps aimed at the protection of the legitimate interests of right holders, specifically as follows:
2.1 Notice of infringement
If the right holders claim that the content or links provided by third parties on the Flyme OS can be possibly in violation of their legitimate rights and interests, they may file a notice of infringement with Meizu, which shall contain the following:
a) Specific information of right holders, including the name, address, e-mail, phone number, copy of a valid identity document (such as identity card, passport and business license);
b) The name of infringing content required to be removed and/or network address of links required to be unlinked;
c) Initial evidence of infringement, including but not limited to the ownership documents that can prove the right holders' legal right of the alleged infringement and descriptions about the infringement facts.
The notice of infringement must be signed by the right holder or an authorized person. In case the right holder is legal person or other entities, official seal is required.
The right holder shall be responsible for the authenticity of his notice, and assume full legal responsibility arising therefrom.
After receipt of such notice by Meizu, a formal examination shall be conducted within a reasonable period of time. Provided the notice meets the aforesaid requirements, Meizu will remove the alleged infringing content and/or disconnect the allegedly infringing link in accordance with provisions of laws and regulations. At the same time, Meizu reserves the right to require the right holder to provide further evidence for the purpose of review, for which the right holder shall cooperate.
While deleting the content of complaint or disconnects the link pursuant to laws and regulations, Meizu will transfer the notice of infringement to the content or link provider; if as a result of unknown address the notice cannot be transferred, Meizu will publish the notice of infringement on the Internet.
2.2 Counter notification
The content or link provider can file a counter notification in writing to Meizu requesting recovery of deleted content or broken links within 3 working days after receipt of the notice of infringement transferred by Meizu or having learned it through the Internet, provided that he thinks the content or links he provides has not violated the rights of others.
The counter notification shall include the following:
a) Specific information of content or link provider, including the name, address, telephone number, a valid identity document (such as identity cards, passports and business licenses);
b) The exact name and URL corresponding to the content or links required to be restored;
c) Initial evidence of non-infringement, including but not limited to the ownership documents that can prove their legal rights to the allegedly infringing content or links, and descriptions of non-infringement facts.
The counter notification shall be signed by the right holder or a legally authorized person, and an official seal needs to be affixed for an organization or institution.
The service object shall be responsible for the authenticity of the counter notification, and assume full legal responsibility arising therefrom.
After receiving the counter notification submitted by the content or link provider, a formal examination shall be conducted within a reasonable period of time, and if the counter notification meets the aforesaid requirements, Meizu will immediately restore the deleted content or broken links, while transferring the counter notification to the right holder. The right holder shall not request Meizu again to delete the content, or disconnect the links.
2.3 Submission of notice of infringement and counter notification
The notice of infringement and counter notification shall be filed to Meizu through the following approaches:
a) To send a scanned copy to: ipr@meizu.com;
b) To mail written documents to: Intellectual Property Rights Department, Meizu Tech Bldg., Technology and Innovation Coast, Zhuhai (Postal Code: 519085).
The deletion or restoration of content and disconnection or reconnection of links are conducted by Meizu in accordance with laws and regulationw, for which Meizu does not undertake any responsibility.
Within the scope permitted by laws, the final interpretation of this Statement is owned by Meizu.
©Meizu Telecom Equipment Co., Ltd. "

"Meizu and its partners (hereinafter referred to as \"Meizu\", the \"Company\", \"We\") understand the importance of privacy for customers. We strive to clearly explain how we collect, use, disclose, transfer and store your information. The privacy policy outlines our information processing approach.
Meizu has always attached great importance to the protection of privacy for users (including natural persons, legal persons and other organizations through legitimate access to or use of this product, hereinafter referred to as \"Users\" or \"You\"). In order to better protect your rights of using the products and your personal information, we hereby disclose product or service usage, users' rights and obligations, as well as the collection, usage, storage, security protection, and way of disclosure of users' personal information and data. Before using the products or services, be sure to read and fully understand the requirements and limitations in this \"Privacy Statement\" (hereinafter referred to as the \"Statement\"), which is provided with independence and integrity. When you choose to use this product, you are deemed to have understood and agreed to all the terms in this Statement, and voluntarily assume full responsibility and risks in the use of the product or service. If you do not agree to this Statement, please terminate your use of our products or services.
What personal information do we collect?
Two types of information are collected from you:
Information you provide to us:
When you sign up for a Meizu account, you may be required to provide your personal information to us, such as your name, e-mail address, phone number and ID number.
Information we collect during your use of our products and services:
You may be required to provide your mailing address, bank account number, etc.
If necessary, we will also collect product-related information, such as the IP address, Cookie, location information, product manufacturer, device model, product unique identifier, device data or other information.
Why do we collect your personal information?
There are two main reasons based on which we need to collect your personal information: 1) Part of our services can be provided only after your information is obtained; 2) Your information will help us optimize the products and services to better meet your needs and provide you with more convenient customization services.
How do we collect your personal information?
1. Information you provide directly
Some services require you to provide information directly to us. For example:
Many of our services allow users to create an account or profile. Among these services, we may ask you to provide certain personal information in order to set up the account or profile. For example, when you create a Meizu account, you may need to submit certain personal information, such as your name, phone number, email address and ID number.
If you order a product or paid service from us, we may ask for your name, contact information, shipping address, billing address, and credit card information for us to process your order.
2. Information about service usage
In addition to the information you provide, we may also collect information about your usage of our services through software on your device as well as other ways. For example, we may collect:
Device information, such as the hardware model, phone number, IMEI number and other unique device identifier, MAC address, IP address, operating system version, and settings of the device used to access the services.
Log information, such as the time and duration of your use of the services, the search words entered through the search services, and any information stored in cookies set on the device.
Location information, such as information about the IP address of the device that may be sent to us when you use certain services.
Voice messages, such as the voice we recorded (and may store on our server) when you use voice commands to control the services. (Please note that we work with a third-party service provider that delivers voice-to-text conversion service on our behalf. The provider may receive and store certain voice commands.)
For additional information about your use of the services, such as apps used, websites visited and how you interact with the service content.
3. Information from a third-party source
We may obtain your information from public sources (where permitted by law) and may combine it with information we receive or other information about you. If you choose to connect to third-party network services, we may also get your information from these services.
4. Other information we collect
We may also collect additional information about you, your device or use of services through other means, which will be described to you or your permission will be required for before or during the collection.
You can choose not to provide certain types of information (for example, information what we request when we improve the profile of your Meizu account), but this may affect your access to certain services.
How do we use collected personal information?
1. Register you or your device for services;
2. Provide services or features that you request;
3. Provide customized content and make recommendations for you according to your past use of our service activities;
4. Advertising, such as provide customized advertising and sponsorship content (through our advertising services, you can learn more about our practice here) and send you promotional information;
5. Assess and analyze markets, customers, products, and services, as well as ask your opinions about our products and services, and conduct customer surveys;
6. Learn how you use our services in order to improve our services and develop new products and services;
7. Provide maintenance services for your device;
8. To the extent applicable laws permit, hold a free prize draw, contest or promotion;
9. Other uses after gaining your consent.
How do we store and protect your personal information?
To ensure that your information will not be accessed, used or disclosed without authorization, Meizu uses generally accepted industrial security standards and take encryption measures to protect users' personal identity information and data.
On the technical side, Meizu uses antivirus software, encryption protection, and monitoring systems to enhance defense and protection for Meizu data center. In the aspect of system, through security and privacy protection training conducted to Meizu staff, employees' understanding of the importance of data protection is ensured. However, based on the inherent defects of and running risks on the Internet, Meizu does not guarantee that your information is absolutely secure.
Third-party links and products
Where texts or icons indicate a service from a third party, the final content of the service is determined and provided by the third party, and we do not carry out any form of censorship on its content, and also we shall not be responsible for security or privacy of any information collected on these websites or by other services. You shall exercise caution and view the privacy statements applicable to the third-party websites and services used.
Disclosure of information
We will not disclose your personal information to third parties, except in the following circumstances:
1) With your consent
Only with your consent shall we disclose your personal information to a third party.
2) Disclose your personal information to our affiliates or partners
In order to provide better services, we may disclose part of your personal information to our affiliated companies or partners, but we will strictly prohibit our affiliates or partners from sharing the information for any other purpose.
3) In accordance with legal requirements
In accordance with the requirements of laws, regulations, judicial or government authorities, we may disclose your personal information. In the case we are dealing with restructuring, merger or liquidation, your personal information may be transferred to the counterparty.
Cookies and other technologies
In order to optimize the user experience, we will collect cookies data generated when users are using the products or services. Our cookies will not be used to identify your personality, but only for you to enjoy better and more convenient services.
Legal Liabilities
1. Users shall use the product based on reasonable and bona fide principles. If any damage or third party litigation is caused as a result of your misuse, we will retain the right to defense and to seek compensation, the extent of which includes but is not limited to losses arising due to your misconduct, including but not limited to court costs, attorney fees, transportation fees and travel expenses.
2. The Statement is governed by the laws of the People's Republic of China. Any disputes arising from this Statement shall be settled through consultation. In case such consultation fails, the dispute may be submitted to the court in the area where Meizu is located for settlement.
Renewal of the Privacy Statement
In keeping with the products, services and laws and regulations, this Privacy Statement will be modified or changed at any time, which will be published promptly once it happens. You can continue to view this Website or use Meizu products and services after such modifications or changes, which will be deemed as having accepted our modifications or changes to this Privacy Statement."

" This service-related feature connects to the Internet (networked) where necessary, obtains your location (location) or reads your personal information, including but not limited to: 1. Meizu Account will access your messages to get verification codes for quicker signup. 2. mPay needs to send and read messages, taking pictures to fulfill payment and improves the payment experience. 3. Data Sync will secure your data by synchronizing your contacts, messages and call logs to the cloud. 4. Yellow Pages and Security will identify and/or block incoming calls and messages by reading and analyzing your contacts, call logs, and messages. 5. Voice Settings needs the permission to record audio to provide better voice-related services. 6. Number Identifier will read your contacts, call logs, and messages to identify phone numbers, tag unknown numbers or find a number's registered location. 7. System UI will read your contacts for multi-user switch. 8. For greater accuracy, push services, Cloud Account, mPay, Event Center, Meizu Account, Life, O2O, Yellow Pages, Network Location, System UI Tools, Security, Pedometer, Messages, Battery Manager, NetAdmin, Crash Reporter, Themes, Number Identifier, System UI and Phone Services will enable location services when the device is connected to the internet. 9. The following apps and services can only function properly when connected to the internet: push services, Cloud Account, Data Sync, O2O, mobile payment services, mPay, Phone Finder, Weather, News, Cloud Album, Benefits Center, Meizu Account, Event Center, App Store, Themes, Game Center, Security, Pedometer, Package Installer, Smart Voice, Voice Settings, Videos, Messages, media services, system framework services, Search, System UI Tools, System Launcher, Easy Mode, Home Screen Backup, Network Location, Yellow Pages, Flyme Communications, Battery Manager, Crash Reporter, NetAdmin and SoftSIM.
It is your sole responsibility to pay for cellular data, calls, messages and all other charges by the carrier generated during your use of Flyme. If you purchase value-added services for which fees are charged by their providers, please consult the providers on relevant rates and charges.
Your location information might be recorded by the location services of Flyme and provided to other Flyme services or third-party applications. Hence, to protect your private information, we kindly suggest you use caution when any third-party application requests the permission to access your location. In order to serve you better, your device may regularly send information about you and itself to designated service operators via WLAN or cellular network. The service operators undertake that such information will be utilized only in an analytical manner for improving services or providing customized services or technologies, and will not be disclosed in any personally identifiable form."

"Thank you for choosing Flyme Smartphone Operating System (\"Flyme\"). To improve your experience with internet-based services, Flyme will connect to the internet, use your location or access your personal information when necessary.
1. Meizu Account will access your messages to get verification codes for quicker signup. 2. mPay needs to send and read messages to fulfill payment. 3. Yellow Pages and Security will identify and/or block incoming calls and messages by reading and analyzing your contacts, call logs, and messages. 4. Voice Settings needs the permission to record audio to provide better voice-related services. 5. For greater accuracy, push services, Cloud Account, mPay, Event Center, Meizu Account, Life, O2O, Yellow Pages, Network Location, System UI Tools, Security, Pedometer, Messages, Battery Manager, NetAdmin, Crash Reporter and Number Identifier will enable location services when the device is connected to the internet. 6. The following apps and services can only function properly when connected to the internet: push services, Cloud Account, O2O, mobile payment services, mPay, Phone Finder, Weather, Benefits Center, Meizu Account, Event Center, App Store, Security, Pedometer, Package Installer, Voice Settings, Videos, Messages, media services, system framework services, Search, System UI Tools, System Launcher, Easy Mode, Home Screen Backup, Network Location, Yellow Pages, Flyme Communications and Battery Manager.
It is your sole responsibility to pay for cellular data, calls, messages and all other charges by the carrier generated during your use of Flyme. If you purchase value-added services for which fees are charged by their providers, please consult the providers on relevant rates and charges. Your location information might be recorded by Flyme location services and provided to other Flyme services or third-party applications. Hence, to protect your private information, we kindly suggest you use caution when any third-party application requests the permission to access your location. In order to serve you better, your device may regularly send information about you and itself to designated service operators via WLAN or cellular network. The service operators undertake that such information will be utilized only in an analytical manner for improving services or providing customized services or technologies, and will not be disclosed in any personally identifiable form."

Yellow Pages and Security will identify and/or block incoming calls and messages by reading and analyzing your contacts, call logs, and messages. 5. Voice Settings needs the permission to record audio to provide better voice-related services. 6. Number Identifier will read your contacts, call logs, and messages to identify phone numbers, tag unknown numbers or find a number's registered location. 7. System UI will read your contacts for multi-user switch. 8. For greater accuracy, push services, Cloud Account, mPay, Event Center, Meizu Account, Life, O2O, Yellow Pages, Network Location, System UI Tools, Security, Pedometer, Messages, Battery Manager, NetAdmin, Crash Reporter, Themes, Number Identifier, System UI, Phone Services, Camera and XtemUI will enable location services when the device is connected to the internet. 9. The following apps and services can only function properly when connected to the internet: push services, Cloud Account, Data Sync, O2O, mobile payment services, mPay, Phone Finder, Weather, News, Cloud Album, Benefits Center, Meizu Account, Event Center, App Store, Themes, Game Center, Security, Pedometer, Package Installer, Smart Voice, Voice Settings, Videos, Messages, media services, system framework services, Search, System UI Tools, System Launcher, Easy Mode, Home Screen Backup, Network Location, Yellow Pages, Battery Manager, Crash Reporter, NetAdmin, Camera, SoftSIM and XtemUI.
It is your sole responsibility to pay for cellular data, calls, messages and all other charges by the carrier generated during your use of Flyme. If you purchase value-added services for which fees are charged by their providers, please consult the providers on relevant rates and charges.
Your location information might be recorded by the location services of Flyme and provided to other Flyme services or third-party applications. Hence, to protect your private information, we kindly suggest you use caution when any third-party application requests the permission to access your location. In order to serve you better, your device may regularly send information about you and itself to designated service operators via WLAN or cellular network. The service operators undertake that such information will be utilized only in an analytical manner for improving services or providing customized services or technologies, and will not be disclosed in any personally identifiable form."

"1. Data you provide directly Some services may require you to provide data directly to us, such as those allowing users to create an account or profile. In such services, we may ask you to provide certain personal data in order to set up the account or profile for you. For example, when you create a Meizu account, you may need to submit certain personal data, such as your name, phone number, email address and ID number; when you order a product or a paid service from us, we may ask for your name, contact information, shipping address, billing address, and credit card information so as to process your order.
2. Data about service usage In addition to the data you provide, we may also collect data about your use of the Services through the software on your device and by other means. For example, we may collect: Device information, such as the hardware model, phone number, IMEI number and other unique device identifiers, MAC address, IP address, operating system version, and settings of the device used to access the Services. Log data, such as the time and duration of your use of the Services, the search words entered through the Services, and any data stored in the cookies set up on the device. Location data, such as the information about the device’s IP address, and other data that may be sent to us when you use certain services. Voice data, such as the voice we record (and may store on our server) when you use voice commands to control the Services. (Please note that we work with a third-party service provider that delivers speech-to-text conversion service on our behalf. The provider may receive and store certain voice commands.) Other information about your use of the Services, such as apps you use, websites you visit, and how you interact with contents provided by the Services.
3. Data from third parties We may obtain your data from public sources (where permitted by law) and may combine such data with other information received by us or related to you. If you choose to connect to third-party network services, we may also get your data from such services.
4. Other data we collect We may also collect additional data about you, your device or your use of the Services by other means, which we will make clear to you or request your permission for when collecting such data. You can choose not to provide certain types of data (for example, the information we request to complete the profile of your Meizu account), but this may affect your access to certain services."

2. Notice of infringement and counter notice According to the laws and regulations of China, Meizu has developed measures and steps aimed at the protection of the legitimate rights and interests of right holders, specifically as follows: 2.1 Notice of infringement: if a right holder claims that the service, content or link provided by a third party in the Flyme OS is possibly in violation of his, her or its legitimate rights and interests, such right holder may file a notice of infringement with Meizu, which shall contain the following: a) specific information of the right holder, including the name, mailing address, e-mail address, phone number, and copy of a valid identity document (such as identity card, passport and business license); b) the name of the infringing service or content (hereinafter referred to as “Allegedly Infringing Content”) required to be terminated and/or removed, and the URL of the link required to be disconnected; c) initial evidence of infringement, including but not limited to the ownership documents that can prove the right holder’s legal right to the Allegedly Infringing Content, and a description of the alleged infringement fact. The notice of infringement shall be signed by the right holder or an authorized person, and in case the right holder is a legal person or an entity, shall also be affixed with the official seal. The right holder shall be responsible for the authenticity of his, her or its notice of infringement, and assume full legal responsibility arising therefrom. After receipt of such notice by Meizu, a formal examination shall be conducted within a reasonable period of time. Provided the notice meets the aforesaid requirements, Meizu will remove the Allegedly Infringing Content and/or disconnect the allegedly infringing link in accordance with provisions of laws and regulations. At the same time, Meizu reserves the right to require the right holder to provide further evidence for the purpose of the examination, for which the right holder shall cooperate. While removing the allegedly infringing content and/or disconnecting the allegedly infringing link pursuant to laws and regulations, Meizu will transfer the notice of infringement to the content or link provider; if as a result of unknown address the notice cannot be transferred, Meizu will publish the notice of infringement on the internet.
2.2 Counter notice: the content or link provider can file a counter notice in writing to Meizu requesting recovery of removed content or broken link within 3 working days after receipt of the notice of infringement transferred by Meizu or having learned it through the internet, provided that he, she or it thinks the Allegedly Infringing Content has not violated the rights of others. The counter notice shall include the following: a) specific information about the content or link provider, including the name, mailing address, phone number and valid identity document (such as resident identity card, passport and business license); b) the exact name and URL of the content or link required to be recovered; c) initial evidence of non-infringement, including but not limited to ownership documents that can prove the content or link provider’s legal rights to the removed content or broken link, and a description of the non-infringement fact. The counter notice shall be signed by the right holder of the content or link or a legally authorized person, and an official seal needs to be affixed if the right holder is an organization or institution. The content or link provider shall be responsible for the authenticity of the counter notice, and assume full legal responsibility arising therefrom. After receiving the counter notice submitted by the content or link provider, Meizu shall conduct a formal examination within a reasonable period of time; if the counter notice meets the aforesaid requirements, Meizu will immediately recover the removed content or broken link, while transferring the counter notice to the right holder who filed the notice of infringement. In case of any objection to the content of the counter notice, the right holder shall notify Meizu and address the reasons and evidence supporting the objection, but cannot request Meizu to remove the content or disconnect the link again for the same reasons or evidence in the original notice of infringement.
2.3 Submission of notice of infringement and counter notice: Notices of infringement and counter notices shall be filed to Meizu through the following approaches: a) send scanned copies to ipr@meizu.com; b) mail written documents to Intellectual Property Rights Department, Meizu Tech Bldg., Technology and Innovation Coast, Zhuhai (postal code: 519085). Removal or recovery of content and disconnection or reconnection of links are conducted by Meizu in accordance with laws and regulations, for which Meizu does not undertake any responsibility."
